item.title: Java static keyword and why we use it?
item.description: Static In simple words: static means the variable or methods that assigned to are belonging to the class, not the object. Therefore, there’s only one copy of the variable/method in the memory. When create an object where all instance variables aren’t static, every object will own its memory space, and its own copy of value.
